intro: Borreria corymbosa, commonly known as red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round, red berries. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Borreria corymbosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
